title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Mathematics Learning Design Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in elementary mathematics education and basic familiarity with cognitive load theory
context.additional_context: Training program for in-service elementary teachers to enhance math education effectiveness through cognitive load measurement and design methodology

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods for measuring cognitive load (N1/P2 ERP components) under varying stimulus conditions (numerical color/notation formats).
Learners can design mathematics learning materials by applying cognitive load theory (intrinsic/extraneous/germane load).
Learners can complete projects evaluating instructional design effectiveness through ERP (electroencephalography) data analysis.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
